radiographic_examinations.findings: bibasilar alveolar opacities as more prominent in the right lung
mixed alveolar ground glass opacities and a prominent right hilar lymph node (3.9 × 2 cm)
a large heterogeneous central hepatic lesion (19.3 × 15 × 8.7 cm) abutting the middle hepatic and left portal veins, with multiple satellite nodules
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: An abdominal CT scan performed 3 years earlier was unremarkable

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: whole-body positron emission tomography scan (WB 18F-FDG PET/CT Scan)
radiographic_examinations.findings: low cervical, mediastinal, bilateral hilar, right axillary, and periportal adenopathy, as well as intense heterogeneous uptake of FDG in the liver
a 50% decrease in the size of the liver lesion, with residual satellite lesions
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: size of the liver lesion decreased after 7 months of treatment
